oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Binding of Doxycycline to Plasma Albumin of Several Species
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Riond , Jean-Luc
Riviere, J. Edmond
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: doxycycline
plasma albumin
graduate research
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Association constants (Ka) and number of binding sites (n) were determined by means of double reciprocal plots and Scatchard plots to characterize the interaction of doxycycline with plasma albumin of several species. Albumin fraction V (Sigma Chemical) was dissolved in 0.2 M NaPO₄H at a concentration of 2 X 10⁻⁴ M. Solutions of doxycycline in distilled water (free fraction) or acetonitrile:85% phosphoric acid:water (20:2:78; total fraction) were mixed 1: 1 with the albumin preparations to obtain final doxycycline concentrations of 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, 100, 200 and 300 ug/ml.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 121
